intro: Hieracium oxyodon subsp. farinicaule, commonly known as the rough hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate and often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. The subspecies is distinguished by its rough, hairy texture and specific geographic distribution.
